title: 110_s3488
content: The Act is titled the "Incentive to Serve Tax Act" and introduces a tax credit for qualified donations of employee services under section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Incentive to Serve Tax Act" introduces a tax credit for qualified donations of employee services under section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The qualified employee service donation credit is 25% of qualified wages paid to eligible employees for performing qualified services, with a limit of $100,000 per year. The term 'qualified wages' excludes wages used for the Work Opportunity Credit or Indian Employment Credit. An 'eligible employee' is defined as someone who works at least 160 hours for the employer performing qualified services. The term 'qualified services' refers to eligible direct services provided to recipients of charitable organizations, coordination of volunteer activities, and capacity building for these organizations. Eligible direct services are those that advance specific objectives. The term 'qualified services' refers to direct services that advance education, healthcare access, energy conservation, economic opportunities, and disaster preparedness. Tax credits are subject to verification by the Secretary to ensure the performance of these services. Special rules apply for this section. The tax credit under section 45Q(a) is treated as a business credit, with special rules similar to section 52 applying. Conforming amendments include adding the qualified employee service credit under section 45Q(a) to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include the qualified employee service credit under section 45Q(a). Section 148 of the National and Community Service Act of 1990 is amended to exclude the amount of an educational award from an individual's gross income for tax purposes under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this section apply to wages paid or incurred after the enactment of this Act.
